Language settings have been changed. Please restart the game for the changes to take full effect.
Your creation '%1%' has been successfully saved!
Your creation '%1%' is a duplicate of a saved creation.
The name you have entered is not valid. Please enter another name.
That name is already in use. Please choose a different name.
You have not yet met this character.
You have not yet discovered this ingredient.
You have met this character, but you do not know them well. Complete quests and special orders involving them to learn more about their history and preferences.
Select an entry from the list to view its details.
Are you sure you want to quit %gamename%?
Are you sure you want to delete the player %1%?
I'll pay %2% a case for %1%. I see you have %3%. Enter the number you would like to sell below and click Sell.
I'm selling %3% of %1% for %2% each. Enter the number of %3% you would like below and click Buy.
It looks like you have some ingredients we haven't seen before. We'll grab one sack of each so it will be available for use in our test kitchens.

You do not currently have any spaces available in the recipe book for your own recipes.

With your continued success, the Board of Directors will provide more spaces so you can create (and sell) your own inventions. Would you like to come inside anyway?

Way to go - you have completed the entire recipe book!

While you won't be able to add any more recipes, you are certainly welcome to poke around and experiment as much as you wish.

Would you like to step inside now?
Don't forget to click %configure% and prepare the factory to make %b02%.
Machinery has been paused. Press OK to continue production.

You have 60 seconds to set our production rate.

Aim and click to fire ingredients - match the full tray you see on the right.

I'll speed the machines up as you succeed, and slow them down if you miss.

Good luck!

Uh-oh! Wasted ingredient!

Use the full tray on the right as your guide.

I'll keep track of each ingredient you waste up on the right.
Waste 8, and I'll be forced to halt production...

Aim and fire ingredients to form rows of at least 3 ingredients on the moving conveyor belt.

Matched ingredients will fill the coffee-making machinery on the right.

Matches of more than 3 ingredients in a row earn bonus products.

Uh-oh! Wasted ingredient!

Fire ingredients at blank squares on the grid to try to form lines of at least 3.

I'll keep track of each ingredient you waste. Waste 8, and I'll be forced to halt production...

Production Rate: %1% cases per week.

As long as you have the needed ingredients in stock, we'll keep on making %1% cases each and every week.
You are missing the ingredients required to make this recipe.
Feeling lucky? Would you like to try a traditional slot machine? Or play hide and seek for money in spare boxes?
You got me this time! You win %2%.
Looks like I win %2%. Better luck next time!
It's a tie! I'll keep the %1%, and you keep the rest.
Feeling lucky, <player>? Would you care to try your hand at a simple game of chance?

Raise or lower your bet and press %start%.
The more you wager, the more I'll place in these boxes.
Open boxes, and stop at any time to keep the money you've uncovered. But uncover a whammy, and I'll keep all the dough...
OK, I've put more than %1% in these boxes. Open as many as you wish, but remember: uncover a whammy and the game ends.
There are still more boxes to open! Go ahead and open another one, or click %done% to bank your winnings...
Stop now or open more boxes. The choice is yours!
You can avoid a loss by clicking %done%, or keep trying for more.
Well, that's it. Once you uncover a whammy, the game's over. I'll keep your bet and wish you better luck next time...
Nicely done. It pays not to be too greedy!
or continue opening crates to try for more!
Give the slot machine a pull! Each pull will cost %1%... but you may hit the jackpot!
You broke even that time... another spin will cost %2%.
Jackpot! Your %2% bet just paid out %1%! Try again?
Well done! You won %1% for a %2% bet. Pull the arm for another try.
Nothing. Give the slot machine another pull for %1% and see if your fortunes change.

One of your factories has stalled!

You need to have enough ingredients on hand to keep the machinery running while you travel so they can continue to produce chocolates for you to sell. Roll your mouse over the Factory Status window below to find out where to buy the ingredients you need.
Deliver %1% cases of %2% for %3% at %6% in %7%.

SPECIAL ORDER RECEIVED:
%1% cases of %2% for %3%.
Will pay %4%.
Required within %5% weeks or order will be cancelled.
You have not yet sold this product.
Last seen for %2% per case in %1%.
You have not yet priced this ingredient.
This factory is not equipped to make this type of product.
This factory is configured to make %1% cases per week.
The %1% factory has not been configured for this product.
To configure the factory for this recipe, you must have the required ingredients on hand.
Your %1% factory will make %2% of these per week.
Click to telegraph a change order.
This space is now available! Visit the Secret Test Kitchen to create your own recipe!

You do not currently have any spaces available in the recipe book for your own recipes.

With your continued success, the Board of Directors will provide more spaces so you can create (and sell) your own inventions.
You do not yet know this recipe.
This trip will take one week
This port is not yet available.
To make this product, we'll have to equip the factory to make %1%. It will cost %2%, and you have %3%. Do you want to purchase the machinery now?
To make this product, we'll have to equip the factory to make %1%. It will cost %2%, and you only have %3%. Come back when you have enough money, and we can get the new machinery set up here.
Select the ingredients to use from the drawers. Click %invent_taste% and we'll give you some feedback on what you've got.
You should give your new recipe a name and a description before adding it permanently to your recipe book.
There is already a recipe with that name. Why not choose another name so you don't confuse your customers?
Are you sure you want to add this recipe to our recipe book? Adding a recipe will permanently use up one of your available spaces.

You are not working on a particular quest. Ask around!

Board members can also be good sources for ways to grow your business.

Click %finished_quests% to review the quests you have already completed.
Have a sack of %1% in inventory.
Have a case of %1% in inventory.
Invent a new recipe in your Secret Test Kitchen.
Make at least one case of %1%.
Invent a new recipe and make at least %1% cases.
Invent a new recipe and make at least one case.
You have %1% more weeks to complete all tasks.
You have only one more week to complete all tasks.
You must complete these tasks this week.
You have run out of time to complete these tasks.
You have run out of time to complete the tasks required.
%1% will track you down in your travels.
Take ownership of your first shop.
Global high scores allow you to compare your high scores against people across the globe.
Submit your name and score to the global list
*Global score list maintained by PlayFirst: http://www.playfirst.com/privacypolicy.html For privacy purposes, you should not use your full name as your player name.
Congratulations! You earned a new global high score!
Your score did not qualify for a new global high score.

PlayFirst global high scores allow you to compare your scores with people across the globe.

Log scores anonymously or personalize your high score listings by entering your PlayFirst user name and password. PlayFirst members are identified with a P1 icon.

If you are not already a PlayFirst member, register for a free account by visiting http://www.playfirst.com.

The PlayFirst privacy policy can be viewed by clicking this link: Privacy Policy.
By submitting this form, you acknowledge that this information will be publicly available. Privacy Policy
By submitting this form, you acknowledge that this information will be publicly available. Privacy Info

Please do not include any personal information such as your contact information when you submit your high score. By submitting, the name you enter and your high score information is transmitted to PlayFirst, Inc.'s servers and will be available for others to see.

Welcome to the world of Chocolatier!

Generations ago, confectioner Marten Baumeister founded the chocolate company that bears his name, and for over a hundred years, the company has survived family squabbles, hostile competitors, and economic ups and downs.

Today, in the twin shadows of the Great Depression and World War II, the company's factories have been converted for the war effort or lie unused, and the disappearance of her husband Sean has left Alex Tangye Fletcher unavailable to steer the company.

Can you help them?

Your map shows an overview of your chocolate empire, indicating where you are, where you have been, and where you might be going soon.

As you grow your business, you will take control of shops and factories, and there are even rumors of a secret test kitchen where you can invent your own recipes.
Steam rises from operational factories; stalled factories appear red.
As your business expands, shops you own will be marked.
Ports remain locked until you have the proper credentials. You may even discover secret locations that weren't previously visible on the map!
Dots mark available ports. Roll over a port icon for info on cost and length of travel, then click to travel there.

In every port, there are buildings, monuments, parks, and other public spaces full of interesting people.

Buildings you can explore will pulse when you enter a port or roll over them. Click on a building or location to visit -- you never know who you might meet! New ports will become available as you complete quests, build your business, and reach higher ranks.

Vendors in markets and farms hawk the ingredients you need to manufacture your products. Purchases are transported automatically to the factories where they are needed. Some markets carry exclusive ingredients, and you'll buy specialty products directly from the farmers who grow them.
To purchase an ingredient, click on its sack then enter the quantity you desire into the calculator. When you are ready, click the "%buy%" button to complete your purchase.

Pay attention to the seasons, as some ingredients are very expensive when they're not in season. If you don't like the prices you see, haggling with the market owner may get you a lower price...but it may also make them angry, so be careful what you say!

Turn your products into cash at chocolate shops around the world. Vary the products you sell to keep customers interested and keep prices up, and for higher profits consider investing in shops and inventive confections of your own when the opportunity arises.

To sell a product, click on its box and enter the quantity to sell into the calculator. When you are ready, click the "%sell%" button to complete the transaction. As a shortcut, click "%sell_all%" in the calculator to sell all of them at once. Click "%sell_all%" in the shop to sell everything you own.
Some shopkeepers specialize in particular products. Haggling with the shop keeper may get you a better offer for the products they do buy... or it may not!

In your chocolate factories, use the mouse to aim and fire ingredients from the injector into the floating trays.

Fill the trays with ingredients to match the recipe shown in the machinery on the right of the factory screen.

The machine will turn full trays into chocolates as they pass by.

Ingredients that hit a tray snap into the correct slot, but miss 8 times and production will be halted.

Ingredients with colored rings can give you a big production boost. Fill a tray with ingredients of the same color to get an instant bonus.
You have 60 seconds to make as many products as you can. Once configured, the factory will continue making chocolates every week as long as you have enough ingredients on hand.

A wide conveyor belt carries ingredients slowly through your coffee factories. Use the mouse to aim and fire ingredients from the injector onto the conveyor.

Make groups of at least three across or at least three down, and all the matching ingredients touching your groups of three will be carried into the coffee machinery.

The machine produces coffee when it has enough ingredients, and you have 60 seconds to make as many products as possible.
Larger ingredient groups will give you instant product bonuses, so plan your shots carefully. Miss 8 shots and production will be halted.
Once configured, the factory will continue making coffee products every week as long as you have enough ingredients on hand.
In the Secret Test Kitchen, you combine your ingredients in new and interesting ways to create combinations and recipes never seen before.

Bring a sample of the ingredients you collect to your Secret Test Kitchen, where they will be kept in stock for your experiments. Small gray bottles hold places for ingredients you have yet to collect.

To create a recipe, select a product category from the options on the bulletin board, then select ingredients from your drawers, clicking to place ingredients on the plates. Click on a full plate to clear it.
Click "%invent_taste%" to get some feedback from Teddy, then make adjustments and click "%design_recipe%" when you're ready to move on to the next step.
Once you have created the right combination of ingredients in your Secret Test Kitchen, it's important to market it properly.

Using the large left and right arrows on each of the four image options, select the graphics you want to use for your product. Click on the small color swatch below the images to select a tint you like.

Try hitting the "%randomize%" button to create a random look for your creation.

Don't forget to name your recipe and enter a description for your recipe book, and when you're ready, click "%save_recipe%" to add your creation to your recipe book.

Remember, once you add a recipe to your book you will not be able to edit or delete it, but don't worry, the directors of Baumeister Confections will give you plenty of opportunities to experiment with your own recipes.

You'll meet people around the world who may need your help securing ingredients, making products, developing markets, inventing new recipes, delivering goods, and maintaining relationships with friends and loved ones.

Use the Quest Log to keep track of your past accomplishments and your current To Do list. Select a quest in the left column to see the details of the quest you have accepted, including a list of tasks you need to complete.
A green light indicates a goal you have met.
A darkened indicator light indicates a goal you have not yet met.
A blank indicator indicates a reminder without a specific goal.
Your selected quest goal appears in your ledger. The green indicator flashes when you have completed your goals.

During your career as Chocolatier, you will collect, discover, and invent many new recipes to expand your product lines. Your Recipe Book organizes them all for you. Browse your recipes by selecting a category along the top, then select a product in the left panel to review it.
If you do not have all the ingredients required to make the chosen recipe, missing ingredients will be marked by a red X.
Initially, the Creations category will be empty. As your career progresses, you may be given the opportunity to invent your own recipes to fill it.
From inside your factory, you will use your recipe book to configure the factory's production.
You have set the production rate of %1% at %2% per week in %3%.
One of your factories has stalled!
Congratulations! You have achieved the rank of %1%!
Congratulations! You have been awarded the %1%!
The port of %1%. is now available.
The secret port of %1%. is now revealed!
You have learned the recipe for %1%..
You are now the proud owner of %1%. in %2%!
Straightforward, simple, timeless bars of pure cacao and sugar.
Silky milk chocolate, slightly sweeter than our dark chocolate offerings.
Fresh caramel combined with pure dark chocolate.
Wonderful roasted peanuts surrounded by dark chocolate.
Hazelnuts offer a new twist to a classic chocolate bar.
A Baumeister Confections classic offering, chocolate surrounding fresh roasted almonds.
Tart and sweet, chocolate with the essence of fresh lemons.
A taste of summer, chocolate bars made with fresh raspberries.
Refreshing and delicious, pure chocolate infused with fresh mint.
Kissed by nature's sweetener, these bars are truly one of a kind.
Only the finest cacaos from Cameroon are used in these specialty bars.
Nutty pecan filling encased in the finest chocolate covering.
Tangy and sweet, these romantic chocolates make wonderful gifts.
The combination of dark chocolate and fresh ginger is sure to please.
Mouth-watering chocolate with a tinge of pleasantly surprising spices.
Fresh, seasonal blueberries comprise the ganache of these wonderful creations.
Fragrant allspice is the secret to these delightfully romantic sweets.
The finest South American varietal cacao and fresh tart limes lend these chocolates an earthy, densely flavorful finish.
Vanilla and cinnamon - a magical combination!
Sweet fresh mango mingles with spicy cloves in these irresistible confections.
Enchanting macadamia nut ganache enrobed in dark chocolate crafted from Central American varietal cacao.
An unlikely pairing you are unlikely to soon forget - fresh strawberries and anise.
These infusions utilize a special blend of cacaos from around the globe.
Smooth, luxurious milk chocolate surrounds a nutty hazelnut center.
A delightfully sweet combination of rich milk chocolate and fresh honey.
Surprisingly refreshing, Cayenne pepper and ground currants blended in a rich chocolate center.
Delectable chocolate truffles that erupt with sweet and sour goodness.
The kick of wasabi blended with fresh-roasted cashew nougat.
Rich African cacao and exotic saffron make for a full-flavored chocolate.
Aromatic nutmeg and cardamom provide an otherworldly element to these wonderful chocolates.
Roasted sesame seeds, candied ginger and the finest cacaos from Bogota join to create a sensational truffle.
Sweet spiced pumpkin and a combination of South American cacaos make for an incredibly yummy truffle.
Espresso Beans intermingle with specialty cacaos to unleash a truffle with a potent kick.
A melange of the world's finest cacaos are used to create a magical truffle.
Smooth caramel centers, enrobed in luscious dark chocolate, lightly sprinkled with sea salt.
Fresh dates, dipped in velvety dark chocolate, topped with a roasted almond.
Two great tastes - one sweet, one tart, combined and encased in dark chocolate.
Chocolate made from specialty cacaos encase delicate, candied rose petals.
Fresh roasted, salted pistachios dipped in chocolate made from the finest varietal cacaos.
Blended specialty cacaos cover a secret, crunchy concoction made with fresh butter and honey.
Start the evening off right with a refreshing chocolate made with Irish whiskey and fresh mint.
Impossible-to-resist lozenges containing a subtle, sweet chai tea filling.
Natural peanut butter surrounded by decadent chocolate.
Fine chocolate egg shells filled with orange and pecan nougat.
A secret blend of the finest cacaos covering deliciously sweet fresh strawberries.
Made from a special blend of specialty cacaos, these chocolates are then topped with roasted cashews.
Our special blend of beans from around the world.
A hint of spicy cinnamon - perfect for your morning brew!
Kissed with chocolate essence, a wonderful combination in your cup.
With a little extra kick, this blend is not for the weak of heart.
A classic recipe perfect for everyday enjoyment.
A hefty roast - perfect for that first cup in the morning.
A rich, dark and frothy brew.
Just enough mint to make an interesting cup of joe.
Intensely roasted beans; a deep dark coffee drink.
Rich and creamy, this blend is certain to please!
Flavored with fresh roasted hazelnut essence, a wonderful winter treat.
For those looking to spice up their daily routine.
Whole-roasted beans in our secret recipe for warming you up in wintertime.
Using an entire coconut, this tropical blend is smooth and delicious.
Ground coffee and ground spices are the secret behind this delightful blend.
Anise seeds lend this blend an exotic touch.
Rich and sweet, sure to please!
Chocolate, sugar, coffee - what could be better?
You have not yet received any medals. Good luck in your attempt to become CEO of Baumeister Confections!
Congratulations! You've received a new award!
Chocolate Historical Society's Up and Comer Cup
Presented to a budding chocolatier who has arrived with a big splash on the chocolate making scene.
Rowena Baumeister Memorial Plate of Distinction
Conferred on those players who have made at least 8 different chocolate products.
Coffee Roasters Association Medal of Innovation
Granted to those players who have furthered the world of fine coffees by manufacturing at least 10 different coffee products.
Bestowed upon a confectioner whose own inventions have contributed to the appreciation of the finer things in life. Given to you for successfully marketing 3 of your own creations.
Baumeister Confections Employee of the Year
Offered to the individual who contributes above and beyond the call of duty to the corporate efforts. You were given this award for taking ownership of your 3rd shop.
Confectioners Local Union #481 Certificate of Appreciation
Awarded to those chocolate makers who have assumed control of all 6 Baumeister Confections factories.
Presented to those confectioners who have achieved the ultimate rank of %rank_5%.
This plaque is granted to those chocolatiers who have managed to reach every single port in the world.
Harold Würtzheimer Spirit of Invention Prize
This prize is awarded to those players who have, through discovery, invention, and hard work amassed the entire recipe book.
A brief history of Baumeister Confections
Over 100 years ago, Hieronymus Baumeister opened a small shop in Sydney Australia, to peddle his father Marten's chocolate inventions.
A generation later, Baumeister Confections had become a household name worldwide.
As the turn of the century approached, family squabbles nearly destroyed the company.
Sisters Evangeline and Rowena managed to reconcile and return the firm to it's former glory.
But by the roaring 20's the chocolate empire had grown complacent.
Alex Tangye, spirited granddaughter of Evangeline, used secret ingredients and fresh recipes to turn things around.
But now, the one-two punch of the Depression and the Second World War, has left the company splintered once again.
It's great chocolate factories, converted or abandoned, sit idle.
And Alex's husband Sean, disappeared during a dangerous wartime mission.
As Alex sets off to search for Sean, she has no choice but to trust the fate of the company to an outsider.
